page.title: 06KERSEY
page.content: On the wall of one house is a foot scraper which was used when the roads were like dirt tracks.One of the houses near the ford has a horse's tail hanging from the eaves;it used to be a home of a horse vet. There is a general store which sells food and gifts.On a sign outside the shop it says:Ham,bacon and chaps.Chaps are pig's cheeks. The petrol station is old with a pump and sign which is not used anymore. There are several pottery shops which sell hand crafted pots,especially for tourists. In Kersey there is a telephone box and a post box.The mail is collected twice a day and once at weekends. "The Bell"is a public house in Kersey which also has a restaurant.
